name: Wang Zhaojun
bio: Wang Zhaojun is a veteran chef who has spent over 15 years perfecting her craft. Her extensive experience has allowed her to create over 60 delicious recipes, and her dishes have been enjoyed by countless customers over the years.

favorite_dishes.recipe_description: Dan Dan Noodles is a popular Chinese dish that originated in the Sichuan province. It consists of egg noodles served with a spicy sauce made from sesame paste, chili oil, and Sichuan pepper, topped with minced pork and chopped scallions. It is a flavorful and satisfying dish that is perfect for spice lovers.
favorite_dishes.cooking_method:
1. Cook the noodles according to package instructions.
2. In a small bowl, mix together the sesame paste, soy sauce, Chinkiang vinegar, sesame oil, and Sichuan peppercorn oil.
3. In a large skillet over high heat, cook the garlic and scallions until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
4. Add the ground pork and cook until browned, breaking it up into small pieces.
5. Add the vegetable oil and Sichuan peppercorns and stir for 30 seconds.
6. Add the chicken stock and bring to a simmer, stirring occasionally, until the liquid has reduced by half.
7. Add the chili oil and the sesame paste mixture and stir until well combined.
8. Add the cooked noodles to the skillet and toss to coat in the sauce.
9. Serve hot, garnished with additional scallions and sesame seeds, if desired.

favorite_dishes.recipe_description: Szechuan fish is a popular Chinese dish that originated from the Sichuan province. It is a spicy and flavorful fish dish that is made with tender fish fillets, Sichuan peppercorns, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, and chili bean paste. The fish is typically stir-fried with the spicy sauce until it is coated evenly and served with steamed rice. The dish is known for its fiery flavor and tongue-tingling numbness, making it a must-try for anyone who loves spicy food.
cooking_method: Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add Szechuan peppercorns and stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add garlic and stir-fry for another 30 seconds.
Add fish fillets and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until lightly browned.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, sugar, cornstarch, and sesame oil until well combined.
Pour the soy sauce mixture into the wok and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until the sauce thickens and the fish is fully cooked.
Garnish with scallions, red chili pepper, and cilantro leaves.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

favorite_dishes.recipe_description: Crab Rangoon is a popular Chinese-American appetizer made with a cream cheese and crab filling wrapped in wonton wrappers and deep-fried until crispy. It is believed to have originated in the United States in the 1950s, although its exact origins are uncertain. Crab Rangoon is often served with sweet and sour sauce or plum sauce for dipping.
ingredients: 1 can (6 oz) crabmeat, drained, flaked and cartilage removed
cooking_method: In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese, crabmeat, onions, parsley, garlic, Worcestershire sauce, salt and cayenne pepper until blended.
Place 1 teaspoon filling in the center of each wonton wrapper.
Moisten edges with water; fold opposite corners together over filling and press to seal.
In an electric skillet, heat 1 in. of oil to 375Â°.
Fry wontons, a few at a time, for 1-2 minutes on each side or until golden brown.
Drain on paper towels.
